reviewText: The season is when the show started to get funny. They changed the cast to all funny people this time and that was a smart move. It would have never lasted with the original cast the way it was.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Between her babbling and slapstick humor, Ellen gets into scrapes just like Lucy used to... she is SOOOOOO funny! This is the only modern sitcom that makes me laugh out loud. The Ballet episode is HILARIOUS! I couldn't stop laughing! When is the third season being released? Can't wait! These are keepers! And 25 episodes on 3 DVD's - what a deal! Ellen is the funniest comedienne of our time.

reviewText: Season 2 was a lot funnier than season 1, and introduced Paige as ellens best childhood friend, audrey and joe from first season, became regular characters, it didnt however explain what had happened to the other two women characters from season 1

reviewText: After watching season one I had to order the rest of the set.  These are very funny and endearing at the same time.  I regretted the change in cast that occurred but such is life.
summary: If you a Ellen fan you will like this set.

reviewText: This season, I think, is funnier than season 1 because it seems like Ellen Degeneres writes more of her own lines of comedey into the script. Some of the funniest episodes are "The Dentist", "So Funny", "Ballet Class", "The Toast", and finally "The Spa." If your looking for something funny and short to watch, I would recommened getting Season 1 and then getting Season 2.
summary: I think  season 2 is better than season 1
Title: N/A

reviewText: 'Ellen' has been my favourite sitcom since season one. Took me a while to get over the loss of Holly & Anita from season one and I recall actually hating the Paige character for a while which now just seems shocking! I have seen these episodes many many times but they still make me laugh out loud. Ms Degeneres' comic timing is astonishingly perfect but its the supporting characters that pull this show together as everybody gets funny lines and the fun these guys must of had making the show oozes off the screen. I love it. I dont think it will ever be topped.
Title: N/A

reviewText: If you are an Ellen DeGeneres fan like me, then you're happy that this show is finally making its way to dvd.  While it started out slowly (and under a different name, "These Friends of Mine"), in the second season it really picked up steam.  There are some classic episodes here, including many scenes of expertly performed physical comedy that hadn't been seen on TV since Lucy's heyday.I didn't notice any serious picture flaws (like the other reviewer), but I did notice the change in volume from one episode to the next.  One would think that that would be relatively easy to fix when mastering the episodes for dvd.  Hopefully the following seasons will be handled a bit bitter.I'm also disappointed by the relative lack of extras.  It seems as if Ellen wants to have nothing to do with these dvd releases as she has so far not done commentary tracks for either the first or second season.  Hopefully in some future packages she will provide some commentary tracks or interviews regarding her experience working on the show.
summary: bring on the rest of the series!
